searchEngineGuide.title: Custom Search Engine Setup Guide
searchEngineGuide.description: Learn how to set up a custom search engine in your browser to quickly access your bookmarks
searchEngineGuide.howItWorksDescription: By setting up a custom search engine, you can type a keyword (like 'go') followed by a bookmark slug in your browser's address bar to instantly navigate to that bookmark.
searchEngineGuide.urlNote: Use this URL template when setting up your custom search engine. The %s will be replaced with your bookmark slug.
searchEngineGuide.chromiumDescription: Follow these steps to add SlugBase as a custom search engine:
searchEngineGuide.chromiumStep4a: Name: SlugBase (or any name you prefer)
searchEngineGuide.chromiumStep4b: Keyword: go (or any keyword you prefer)
searchEngineGuide.chromiumStep4c: URL: Use the search URL shown above
searchEngineGuide.chromiumStep5: Click 'Add' or 'Save' to complete the setup
searchEngineGuide.firefoxDescription: Follow these steps to add SlugBase as a custom search engine:
searchEngineGuide.firefoxStep2: Navigate to 'Search' in the settings menu
searchEngineGuide.firefoxStep3: Scroll down and click 'Add' under 'One-Click Search Engines'
searchEngineGuide.firefoxStep4a: Name: SlugBase (or any name you prefer)
searchEngineGuide.firefoxStep4b: Keyword: go (or any keyword you prefer)
searchEngineGuide.firefoxStep4c: URL: Use the search URL shown above
searchEngineGuide.usageStep1: After setup, simply type in your browser's address bar:
searchEngineGuide.usageStep2: Press Enter, and you'll be redirected to the bookmark with the slug 'test'
searchEngineGuide.usageNote: Replace 'test' with any bookmark slug you've created in SlugBase!
